definition: gate/door/CL:扇[shan4]/gateway/doorway/CL:個|个[ge4]/opening/valve/switch/way to do something/knack/family/house/(religious) sect/school (of thought)/class/category/phylum or division (taxonomy)/classifier for large guns/classifier for lessons, subjects, branches of technology/(suffix) -gate (i.e. scandal; derived from Watergate)

(after a verb or adjective) one who (is) .../(after a noun) person involved in .../-er/-ist/(used after a number or 後|后[hou4] or 前[qian2] to refer to sth mentioned previously)/(used after a term, to mark a pause before defining the term)/(old) (used at the end of a command)/(old) this
blind monk/refers to famous blind historian 左丘明[Zuo3 Qiu1 ming2]
Buddhist teacher (Sanskrit transliteration)/also written 闍梨|阇梨[she2 li2]
Buddhist teacher (Sanskrit transliteration)/also written 阿闍黎|阿阇黎[a1 she2 li2]
Buddhist teacher (Sanskrit transliteration)/also written 阿闍梨|阿阇梨[a1 she2 li2]

sentences.english: Patriarch Feng was Guru Chen's teacher in Tang Tantra.
sentences.chinese: 冯大阿阇梨是陈上师的唐密教授师。

definition: to hold/to seize/to catch/to apprehend/to take/(used in the same way as 把[ba3]: to mark the following noun as a direct object)
traditionally used as phonetic for ga/also pr. [ga1]/also pr. [qie2]
